title: How to Make Oregano and Thyme Pasta Sauce

steps.headline: Cook onion in olive oil on med-low heat until the onion is translucent, but not brown ( about 5 minutes), stirring occasionally.
Add a bit of salt and pepper.
Add the stewed tomatoes and tomato paste.
steps.description: Crush the tomatoes gently with a potato masher (in the pot).

steps.headline: Shake in a generous helping of oregano and thyme, a bit more salt and pepper, and add a bay leaf.
Stir well.
steps.description: Let simmer (partly covered) on low heat for 50 minutes, stirring occasionally

steps.headline: Taste, and add a bit more salt/pepper if it needs it.
steps.description: If it tastes bitter at all, add a pinch of sugar and stir.

text: Cook onion in olive oil on med-low heat until the onion is translucent, but not brown ( about 5 minutes), stirring occasionally.  Add a bit of salt and pepper.  Add chopped garlic.  Add the stewed tomatoes and tomato paste. Crush the tomatoes gently with a potato masher (in the pot). Shake in a generous helping of oregano and thyme, a bit more salt and pepper, and add a bay leaf.  Stir well. Let simmer (partly covered) on low heat for 50 minutes, stirring occasionally Taste, and add a bit more salt/pepper if it needs it. If it tastes bitter at all, add a pinch of sugar and stir. Finished.
